thread.title: Animals get in the mood for Valentine's Day
thread.title_full: Animals get in the mood for Valentine's Day | Daily Mail Online

author: Stephanie Linning for MailOnline
title: Animals get in the mood for Valentine's Day
text:
Love is in the air as couples around the world prepare for Valentine's Day.
But these heart-warming photographs show it is not only humans who are planning to spoil that special someone.
From the ice caps of Alaska to the Indian grasslands, animals around the world were caught on camera as they shared an intimate moment.
Two manatees looked like the perfect match as they nuzzled together in the water in Florida, while a pair of lizards enjoyed a sunset smooch in Spain.
Meanwhile seals off the Lincolnshire coast and owls in Berkshire prove there are plenty of affectionate animals closer to home. And a pair of snails showed love comes in all shapes and sizes.
However others appeared to be less lucky in love. A zebra was snapped as it tried to turn away from its amorous mate while a desperate flamingo did all it could to woo the object of its desire.
Here, FEMAIL shares some of the most touching moments captured in the love-struck animal kingdom.
Come here, you! A red squirrel reaches out a tiny paw as it tries to bring its mate in for a tender moment in the tree branches
Sleeping beauty: Two young orangutans shared a kiss at the International Animal Rescues Orangutan Rehabilitation Centre in Ketapang, West Borneo, left. Right, a mother giraffe leans down to nuzzle its foal in a tender moment captured on camera
Feathered and flirty: Two owls close their eyes and are lost in the moment as they kiss while perching on a post in Berkshire
Hollywood romance: One young baboon holds another in its arms as they enjoy a sweet moment together, left. Right, a penguin puts a wing around its mate as they look out on a cruise ship sailing away from the a port in the Galapagos Islands
Get off! One zebra in the mood for love, left, struggles to impress its mate, right, in the Maasai Mara Game Reserve, Kenya
Tiny and tender: Two amorous snails lean across the gap between two fungi as they share a slimey kiss on the grass
Gentle giants: Two manatees swim along side-by-side in the water of the Crystal River National Wildlife Refuge in Florida
Lizard loving: One lizard appears to be holding a bouquet out to its mate, left, while two others kiss in the Spanish sunset
Trunk in love: Two Indian elephants become entwined while play fighting at the Corbett National Park, India
Awfully n-ice! Two young polar bears rise up on their hind legs and embrace while play fighting on Barter Island in Alaska
Love birds: One flamingo, left, makes its move and leans in towards its mate in a intimate scene in Camargue, France
Sliding off into the sunset: Two seals touch their noses together as they kiss on the banks at Donna Nook, in Lincolnshire
